metadata.title: CVE-2021-29265 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.7.usbip_sockfd_store in drivers/usb/usbip/stub_dev.c allows attackers tocause a denial of service (GPF) because the stub-up sequence has raceconditions during an update of the local and shared status, akaCID-9380afd6df70.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-aws - 4.4.0-1090.94
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1114.127~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.94').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1114.127~14.04.1').
